summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing a persistent journalist's request for comment on the Epstein investigation. It references an ongoing investigation stemming from evidence seized from Epstein's former butler and includes two attached articles.

persons.name: C. (USAFLS)
persons.context: Sends an email to a colleague regarding a journalist's request for comment on the Epstein case, attaching two articles and providing confidential background that the investigation is continuing.

persons.name: M, (USAFLS)
persons.context: Receives an email from a colleague about a journalist's request and responds that they will not be commenting on the matter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the ongoing investigation referenced in the email, with evidence seized from his former butler.

connections.description: Colleagues within the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) communicating about handling a press inquiry regarding the Epstein investigation.
C. (USAFLS), as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is involved in the ongoing investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Press Inquiry Regarding Epstein Investigation
events.description: A journalist contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking comment on the Epstein case, referencing two internet articles. The office decides not to comment.

events.title: Seizure of Evidence from Epstein's Butler
events.description: An investigation is continuing stemming from the seizure of evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's former butler, as referenced in attached articles and mentioned in the email.

locations.context: Office location of the Assistant U.S. Attorney (C. (USAFLS)) as listed in the email signature.

keyFacts: As of July 2010, the U.S. Attorney's Office confirmed an ongoing investigation related to evidence seized from Jeffrey Epstein's former butler.
The office had a policy of not commenting to the press on the Epstein matter, despite persistent journalistic inquiries.
The communication references two specific internet articles about the case, attached to the email, written by a journalist.
The document shows internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAFLS) to manage public relations regarding the sensitive Epstein investigation.
